title: Irrigation Systems | Crop Production & Management| Middle School Science | Khan Academy

tasks.task: Identify essential components of irrigation and summarize methods used for distributing water to crops.
subtasks: Explain the importance of water in plant survival.
Discuss factors affecting irrigation needs (crop type, soil type, season).
Describe various sources of irrigation water (groundwater, surface water, non-conventional sources).
Outline traditional irrigation methods (pulley system, chain pump, liver system, furrow irrigation) and their efficiency.
Describe modern irrigation techniques (sprinkler and drip irrigation) and their benefits.

tasks.task: Understand the definition and purpose of irrigation.
subtasks: Define irrigation as the process of watering crops at the right time and amount.
Explain why proper irrigation is crucial for plant growth and productivity.

tasks.task: Evaluate the role of irrigation in different agricultural settings.
subtasks: Assess the necessity of considering seasonal changes in irrigation practices.
Compare the water requirements of different crops (e.g., paddy vs. wheat).
Consider the impact of soil type on irrigation frequency and methods.
Recognize the importance of environmental factors (e.g., monsoons) in supplementing or reducing irrigation needs.
